questions.text: What game was Mrs. Luthor and Lex playing at the start of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Chess.

	Lillian Luthor was playing with a teenage Lex. It was the first time that Lex appeared in person in the show, previously he had been mentioned only. That scene was a flashback to the day Lionel Luthor brought Lena home from the adoption agency.

questions.text: Most of Alex's friends were introduced to Maggie as her girlfriend in this episode. Did they previously know she was gay?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Most of the group didn't know. Kara knew, and J'ohnn knew because he was psychic. It was a surprise to the rest of the group, but they were all accepting of it.

questions.text: What did Kara take Lena as a gift?
questions.explanation:
Doughnuts.

	Lena thought Kara was there as a member of the media at first, but Kara quickly put that to rest and told her she was there as a friend. They enjoyed a doughnut together and Kara gave her some advice to go see her mother in prison.

questions.text: Who did Supergirl refer to when she said he literally had no heart?
questions.explanation:
Metallo.

	He was testifying in court for Lillian Luthor. Supergirl's comment referred to his heart having been removed when he was turned into a cyborg several episodes earlier. His heart was replaced with Kryptonite, making him able to defeat both Supergirl and Superman. Before turning into a cyborg, he was known as John Corben.

questions.text: Who was arrested for helping to break Lillian Luthor out of jail?
questions.explanation:
Lena.

	Lena was her adopted daughter. She and her mother don't like each other. She was set up by her mother to take the fall for her prison break. A video of Lena getting Kryptonite out of a safe was doctored to look like her.

questions.text: Mon-El and Eve were still a happy couple during the episode.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Mon-El told Kara that things were going well, but when Kara bumped into Eve at the office Eve told her they hadn't been on a second date. Eve said that "Mike" talked about Kara the entire time and she couldn't stand it.

questions.text: What was wrong with the Kryptonite that was being used by the villain?
options: It was brown, with unknown properties.
questions.explanation:
It was synthetic, and explosive.

	The Kryptonite was synthetic and was about to explode when Winn and other DEO members managed to track it. Supergirl burst into the stronghold where Lillian, Metalo and Cyborg Superman were holding Lena and a store of evil artifacts.

Martian Manhunter.

	He followed her to the stronghold and stopped Metallo from blasting her with his unstable Kryptonite. The two of them then escaped the blast when he exploded.

questions.text: Was Lena Luthor convicted of breaking her mom out of prison?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The headlines were that she was vindicated. Kara then got to gloat to her editor, Snapper Carr, that she didn't have confirmation bias. She had been correct all along.

questions.text: What did Lena send Kara at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Flowers.

	Kara said her office was overflowing with flowers while she was talking with Lena. This was after Kara's story about Lena being innocent ran in the "CatCo. Magazine".
